episodeTitle: To Annihilate the Straw Hats! Legendary Assassins Descend!
episodeTitleJapanese: 一味抹殺！伝説の殺し屋来襲！
episodeTitleRomanized: Ichimi Massatsu! Densetsu no Koroshiya Raishū!
description: The Yeti Cool Brothers arrive to assassinate the Straw Hats on Caesar's orders. Meanwhile, a flashback reveals how Trafalgar Law first arrived at Punk Hazard. Brownbeard is betrayed and killed by Caesar's assassins, and Nami (in Franky's body) is kidnapped.

events.title: Law's Arrival at Punk Hazard Revealed
events.description: A flashback reveals how Trafalgar Law first arrived at Punk Hazard seeking refuge. Caesar Clown agreed to let Law stay on the island in exchange for healing his subordinates, and Law gave Caesar his heart as collateral.
events.significance: Establishes Law's relationship with Caesar and explains his presence on Punk Hazard, setting up future conflicts and revealing Law's vulnerable position.

events.title: Caesar Becomes Suspicious of Law
events.description: Monet informs Caesar that Law has connections to Monkey D. Luffy from their time in Sabaody Archipelago. This makes Caesar suspicious of Law's true intentions and loyalty.
events.significance: Creates tension between Caesar and Law, foreshadowing Law's betrayal and his true alliance with the Straw Hats.

events.title: Yeti Cool Brothers Arrive at the Destroyed Lab
events.description: The legendary assassins Rock and Scotch, known as the Yeti Cool Brothers, arrive at the destroyed laboratory where the Straw Hats and kidnapped children are located. They are massive, fur-covered giants hired by Caesar to eliminate the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Introduces major antagonists for this portion of the Punk Hazard arc and escalates the danger level for the Straw Hats.

events.title: Brownbeard's Betrayal and Death
events.description: Brownbeard encounters Scotch and realizes there's been a mistake, believing he's working with the Yeti Cool Brothers. Scotch plays a recording of Caesar calling Brownbeard a useless idiot and ordering his death. Devastated by the betrayal, Brownbeard is shot by Scotch and goes up in flames.
events.significance: Reveals Caesar's cruel nature and willingness to dispose of loyal subordinates. Brownbeard's death marks a major turning point and demonstrates the ruthlessness of Caesar's operation.

quotes.text: There must have been a mistake. I'm assigned to work with you to take out the Straw Hats!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard's last words before realizing Caesar betrayed him

events.title: Yeti Cool Brothers Attack the Straw Hats
events.description: The Yeti Cool Brothers launch their assault on the Straw Hats at the destroyed laboratory. They use their environmental knowledge and specialized weapons to attack the crew members.
events.significance: Begins a major battle sequence that will continue into the next episodes, testing the Straw Hats' abilities against these legendary assassins.

events.title: Nami (in Franky's Body) Kidnapped
events.description: The Yeti Cool Brothers successfully abduct Nami, who is still in Franky's body due to Law's ability. Luffy attempts to rescue her but fails to catch up to the assassins as they escape with their captive.
events.significance: Creates urgency for a rescue mission and demonstrates the effectiveness of the Yeti Cool Brothers as opponents. The body-swap complicates the situation further.

events.title: Yeti Cool Brothers Report False Kills
events.description: The Yeti Cool Brothers radio Caesar Clown, falsely reporting that they have successfully killed Nami, Zoro, and Brook. They request that the bodies be collected.
events.significance: Shows the assassins' confidence and deception tactics. Caesar believes the Straw Hats are being eliminated, giving him a false sense of security.

events.title: Law Confronts Caesar's Guards
events.description: Trafalgar Law leaves the facility and begins confronting Caesar's subordinates, taking action against the organization despite having given his heart to Caesar.
events.significance: Demonstrates Law's willingness to act against Caesar despite the risk, foreshadowing his true alliance with the Straw Hats and his plan to take down Caesar.

quotes.text: There must have been a mistake. I'm assigned to work with you to take out the Straw Hats!
quotes.speaker: Brownbeard
quotes.context: Brownbeard's desperate plea before learning of Caesar's betrayal

themes.description: The episode explores themes of betrayal through Caesar's ruthless disposal of Brownbeard and the revelation of Law's complicated relationship with Caesar.
themes.symbolism: Brownbeard's death symbolizes the disposability of subordinates to those in power who lack moral integrity.

themes.description: Law's position of having given his heart to Caesar while secretly planning against him represents the conflict between survival and staying true to one's goals.
themes.symbolism: Law's heart being held by Caesar is a literal representation of being trapped in a dangerous alliance.

characterSpotlights.development: Brownbeard's unwavering loyalty to Caesar is shattered when he learns he was considered expendable all along. His death marks a turning point in understanding Caesar's true nature.
keyActions: Is shot and killed by Scotch
quotes: There must have been a mistake. I'm assigned to work with you to take out the Straw Hats!

characterSpotlights.development: Law's backstory on Punk Hazard is revealed, showing his precarious position with Caesar. His connections to Luffy are exposed, creating tension.
keyActions: Flashback shows his arrival at Punk Hazard
His connection to Luffy is revealed to Caesar

characterSpotlights.development: Rock is introduced as one half of the fearsome Yeti Cool Brothers, massive assassins working for Caesar Clown.
keyActions: Participates in attacking the Straw Hats

characterSpotlights.development: Scotch is introduced as the other half of the Yeti Cool Brothers and is directly responsible for Brownbeard's death.
keyActions: Plays Caesar's betrayal recording for Brownbeard
Participates in the Straw Hats attack

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime adapts only pages 2-17 of Chapter 666, extending the content with additional scenes and pacing adjustments typical of the Punk Hazard arc's adaptation.

trivia.fact: The chapter this episode adapts (Chapter 666) has a number often associated with evil, fitting for the dark content including Brownbeard's death and Caesar's betrayal.
The Yeti Cool Brothers are named after alcoholic beverages (Rock and Scotch), continuing One Piece's tradition of themed character names.

sources.title: Yeti Cool Brothers - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: At 4,250 cm (139'5"), the Yeti Cool Brothers are even larger than standard giants in the One Piece world.

sources.title: Yeti Cool Brothers - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode aired during the period (episodes 279-1070) when One Piece did not use ending themes, instead using extended opening sequences.
